channel.title: docker on Mátyás Budavári
channel.description: Recent content in docker on Mátyás Budavári

item.title: Log4Shell Check
item.description: Unless you were under a rock for the past couple of days, I assume you’ve heard about log4shell. The RCE exploit of the popular Java logging module log4j, that caused havoc all over the internet. I haven’t worked with Java for years, but I’m curious if my projects are vulnerable to this exploit. Let’s find out.

item.title: Log4Shell Check
item.description: Unless you were under a rock for the past couple of days, I assume you’ve heard about log4shell. The RCE exploit of the popular Java logging module log4j, that caused havoc all over the internet. I haven’t worked with Java for years, but I’m curious if my projects are vulnerable to this exploit. Let’s find out.

item.title: Strava Activities With Plotly
item.description: I started to run on a weekly basis in last August, I’m fascinated with the data I can collect from each run. I’ve been using Strava ever since. While I was preparing for my previous post about plotly-dash, I decided to dust off my knowledge by creating a simple app to visualize my heartrate data in different activities.

item.title: Postgres External Python Call
item.description: After experiencing the awesomeness of External Calls in Snowflake I decided to look into the possibilities of running external snippets from Postgres.

item.title: ELK adventures
item.description: I have an application that logs a lot, and during development I got tired of looking through the command line for the error logs, that were hidden by other logs (that were also necessary). So I looked around what is the preferred way of handling logs nowadays.
